definition: to die/to depart from the world forever
to resign/to dismiss/to decline/to take leave/ballad (archaic poetic genre)/variant of 詞|词[ci2]

sentences.english: It was a pity that his sea power kingdom was not complete then he passed away.
sentences.chinese: 可惜他的海權王國並未完成，便與世長辭了。

sentences.english: But at this moment came on the death of his father passed away.
sentences.chinese: 然而就在這一刻傳來了他父親與世長辭的噩耗。

sentences.english: The whole world was convulsed over the passing away of the great man.
sentences.chinese: 這位偉人與世長辭，全世界爲之震動。

sentences.english: And the next night he died.
sentences.chinese: 第三天夜裏便與世長辭。

sentences.english: Regardless, the dream of fuel cell-powered vehicles just won't die.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，燃料電池驅動汽車的夢想仍不會與世長辭。

sentences.english: Yes, the King of Pop is dead as well.
sentences.chinese: 是的，這位流行天王也不幸與世長辭了。

definition: to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
Chiang Ching-kuo (1910-1988), son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石, Guomindang politician, president of ROC 1978-1988
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
on one's deathbed/at the point of death
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
Zeppelin (name)/Graf Ferdinand von Zeppelin (1838-1917), inventor of the Zeppelin dirigible airship
death/to pass away (of Buddhist monks, nuns etc)
